      • listUsers

        public java.util.List listUsers(User loggedInUser)
                         throws FaultException
        Lists the users in the org.
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The current user
        Returns:
        Returns a list of userids and logins
        Throws:
        FaultException - A FaultException is thrown if the loggedInUser doesn't have permissions to list the users in their org.

      • listRoles

        public java.lang.Object[] listRoles(User loggedInUser,
                           java.lang.String login)
                             throws FaultException
        Lists the roles for a user
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The current user
        login - The login for the user you want to get the roles for
        Returns:
        Returns a list of roles for the user specified by login
        Throws:
        FaultException - A FaultException is thrown if the user doesn't have access to lookup the user corresponding to login or if the user does not exist.

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • getDetails

        public java.util.Map getDetails(User loggedInUser,
                       java.lang.String login)
                         throws FaultException
        Gets details for a given user. These details include first names, last name, email, prefix, last login date, and created on date.
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The current user
        login - The login for the user you want the details for
        Returns:
        Returns a Map containing the details for the given user.
        Throws:
        FaultException - A FaultException is thrown if the user doesn't have access to lookup the user corresponding to login or if the user does not exist.

      • setDetails

        public int setDetails(User loggedInUser,
             java.lang.String login,
             java.util.Map details)
               throws FaultException
        Sets the details for a given user. Settable details include: first names, last name, email, prefix, and password.
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The current user user.
        login - The login for the user you want to edit
        details - A map containing the new details values
        Returns:
        Returns 1 if edit was successful, an error is thrown otherwise
        Throws:
        FaultException - A FaultException is thrown if the user doesn't have access to lookup the user corresponding to login or if the user does not exist.

        usePamAuth - Should this user authenticate via PAM?
        Returns:

        Throws:

        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The current user
        login - The login for the user you would like to change
        val - The value you would like to set this to (1 = true, 0 = false)

        Throws:

      • addDefaultSystemGroup

        public int addDefaultSystemGroup(User loggedInUser,
                        java.lang.String login,
                        java.lang.String name)
        Add ServerGroup to the list of Default System groups. The ServerGroup MUST exist otherwise a IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The current user in user.
        login - The login for the user whose Default ServerGroup list will be affected.
        name - name of ServerGroup.
        Returns:
        Returns 1 if successful (exception otherwise)

      • removeAssignedSystemGroups

        public int removeAssignedSystemGroups(User loggedInUser,
                             java.lang.String login,
                             java.util.List<java.lang.String> systemGroupNames,
                             java.lang.Boolean setDefault)
        remove system group association from a user
        Parameters:
        loggedInUser - The current user
        login - the user's login that we want to remove the association from
        systemGroupNames - list of system group names to remove
        setDefault - if true the default group will be removed from the users's group defaults
        Returns:
        1 on success
